intro: Ranunculus crussicaulis, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often yellow or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the flowers have five to eight petals that are usually bright yellow. Ranunculus crussicaulis is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to cold climates.
